google_reviews.author: Brant Satala
google_reviews.review:
Nice building in a slightly sketchy part of town.  Kiara and John are great property management/maint. people, super friendly and helpful.  Anywhere you rent is going to have some sort of issue(s) at some point, and Kerf is no exception.  But those issues have been more in the common area on the first floor, and with the gate to the parking lot. I have to be honest, the gate has been broken for most of the months I've lived here (on and off), and there has been NO discount on the $75/month parking fee despite requesting some kind of break because of the sloth-paced repairs.  However, when you sign the lease, Blanton-Turner states they are not responsible for security.  So when the gate breaks, and a car gets broken into, your $75 is not paying for peace of mind of a security gate that works. Mgmt has told us we are responsible for security, and not to let people follow us through the parking gate. Huh?  In a sketchy neighborhood, that's messed up.
It's too bad because it could be so much better here with some easy system improvements and security repairs.
Seems to be a good diversity of people, and also seems like a lot of students.  Personally, I think Kerf is a decent intermediate place to live for 6 months to a year.  I'd really love to give this place 5 stars because there are a couple super people who work here, and some super cool neighbors.  But I can't.
But with the current issues, I wouldn't want to stay for more than that though.

google_reviews.author: Megan Beal
google_reviews.review: Everyone here at Kerf have been amazing and wonderful. John who handles maintenance was super nice and very helpful! He answered all my questions and addressed my concerns. I appreciate him and his time! I have had nothing but positive things from being here so far!

google_reviews.author: James Booth
google_reviews.review:
I'm a current tenant here and in several months I've had zero issues with my apartment. Appliances are great and all work without issue, staff are friendly, very professional, and easy to get ahold of when necessary. Perhaps it is my unit but there hasn't been much noise and this is a community of around 200 people. Considering the very poor quality of many other apartments, and the generally good upkeep of Kerf, I think you're going to have a hard time finding somewhere better. Also the area isn't too bad, is close to many bus lines, and I've generally felt safe in and outside the apartment. The rent is high but high is the going rate in Bellingham and considering that things are largely intact, function as they should, and are clean it's far from the worst bargain you're going to find.

The only real problem that has occurred is a broken parking gate which I think is currently being repaired. That is an issue that has more to do with levels of management far above the on site staff and it is unfair to fault them for it.

google_reviews.author: Macala Rose
google_reviews.review: Absolutely amazing building. Professionally managed, great location and over the top amenities. Highly recommended.

google_reviews.author: Regina Reid
google_reviews.review: Kerf Apartments brings an outdoor feel indoors, but you can also leave the outside rush and feel at home inside. The staff is extremely efficient, helpful, and friendly. The amenities are designed for me-time as well as community. And the modern features are a sustainable business model.

google_reviews.author: Adam House
google_reviews.review:
I've lived in nine states, apartments in most of them, and this is the best building I've come across. The location is great and walkable. Just over a mile to downtown might be a little long for some people, but it's doable, and everything else you need (Walgreens, a few chain restaurants, a few local restaurants, a grocery store, a hardware store, a UPS store, and more) is within a half mile walking distance on Samish Way, which is a bit loud to walk on but not too bad, and it has nice wide sidewalks, bus stops going both directions, and good pedestrian crossings.

As for the building itself, the staff at Kerf is fantastic. Joshua, Caitlin and Kiara are all very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Management seems good and the online community & payments portal is good. Digital access works well. The only thing to note is that there is no guest parking, but Bellingham is small and when I have a guest, I've been fine with reimbursing a quick Uber or picking them up myself or whatever. Apartments are well built and the units are well soundproofed. Shared amenities are great too. The gym is stocked really well compared to many apartment gyms as well, and feels spacious because it has a second level. You can tell Blanton Turner (the management company) credibly cares about the wellbeing of their residents and about getting the details right.

Overall this building is a gemmy favorite I've lived at in my adult life!and I am excited for it to be my home for years to come.

google_reviews.author: Jay James
google_reviews.review: I highly recommend The Kerf Apartments! I had a fantastic tour and was impressed by the excellent amenities at this apartment building. The manager, Joshua, was incredibly kind and always had a smile on his face. The proximity to downtown is definitely a major plus.

google_reviews.author: Grace Leddige
google_reviews.review: Im obsessed with this place! Everyones been so nice and welcoming. Management is the best and theyre always on top of everything/whatever is needed. The amenities are soooo fun! Ive saved money every month by not going out and just using the amenities here. The gym has everything you need, the golf simulation has more than just golf (the zombie dodge ball is personally my favorite with friends), the roof top bbq is gorgeous. Ive lived in a lot of apartment complexes, but this is by far the best one . I highly highly recommend this place to any/everyone.

google_reviews.author: Le Derppz
google_reviews.review: The Parking  garage gate has been broken for almost a month leaving it open to vandalism,  walls are thin, weed smell.  Bikes stolen from Bike rooms, car break ins. Management will not repair things.  Stay away at all costs.  There is a bribing process for the reviews, they will give you a beanie if you review it well.

google_reviews.author: Sharlaine LaClair
google_reviews.review:
This place is so beautiful! It has all the amenities, and amazing place for remote work or studying,  plus it's pet friendly. The units are spacious and have high end finishes. Love it!
The only downside is parking. There is no visitor parking and if you want a parking space its one per tenant which you have to pay $75/month for. Managements hands are tied though with limited parking spaces. There are 5-6 free curbside public parking spots that fill up quickly, and other public parking and/or monthly parking areas are not within walking distance.

Im big on reviews, **especially** when looking at apartments/property mgmt companies and even more so when out of stateso I hope this helps someone else take the plunge bc trust that I will update this review to keep potential neighbors informed if anything becomes a major issue! Thank you
